venue.venue_name: Cock & Bull Public House Mainstrasse Village

items.badge_description: We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 85 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 18!

Youâve pledged allegiance, and now itâs time to enjoy some beer! Now remember, not all American beer is fizzy and yellow. Thatâs 195 different beers from a brewery in the United States. Try 5 more for Level 40.

items.checkin_comment: Great IPA and I love how it comes in a can. Glad to have Mad Tree up here in Cbus

user.bio: Retired. Love visiting brewpubs and craft breweries.

items.comment: Probably my favorite beer by them.

items.checkin_comment: Tasty. I find it more interesting the lady old enough to be my grandmother knew what she was talking about

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now itâs time to drink it! Thatâs 90 check-ins with a photo.

beer.beer_description: The subtle malt backbone combats the bitterness and intensity of floral, grassy, and citrus hop flavors. However, taste is perception. Whatâs your slant?

This dry-hopped ale combines caramel and 
biscuit malt flavors in happy equilibrium with 
late addition American hops. The 
approachable balance is intentional although 
the name is a âhoppyâ accident.

Specialty malts bring intimations of brown sugar and vanilla which meld into the Gnarlyâs character. Roasted coffee malt flavors and residual sweetness dance in harmony, obscuring the line between brown ale and porter.
The lightest of the offerings at MadTree. There's nothing terribly fancy about this beer, but at 4.7% ABV and 11 IBUs, it's a very light, crisp, and approachable beer.

There are three things we have learned to never discuss with people here: religion, politics and The Great Pumpkin, But that doesn't mean we can't welcome our own Great PumpCan. So sing pumpkin carols and enjoy MadTree's way of delivering some delicious pumpkin pie flavor right to your gullet.

The conditions have to be just right for the formation of Thundersnow. Ginger, nutmeg and vanilla, hints of cinnamon and a bready malt sweetness create a storm of flavors. When you find this rare occurrence, savor it as long as you can.

At Galaxy High, the beer has 120 IBUs, 10.2% ABV yet finishes nice and dry. Join two New Zealand hops as you encounter a crazy collection of tropical and dank flavors throughout this Imperial IPA. Itâs big on your palateâ¦ disruptive even. Think "trophic cascades" disruptive.
A sessionable pale ale brewed with rye lending to an earthy, spicy flavor complemented by a heavy dose of SimcoeÂ®, post-fermentation.

Not a ray of light penetrates the soul of this 
beer. Combining the roasted malt backbone of 
a Porter with a huge amount of earthy and 
citrusy hops typical in many IPAâs, this unique 
ale will leave you questioning its identity and 
maybe yours.

Whether you drift along in life, drift down the river, or just want to drift through a drinking session, Sol Drifter will let you go where you want by delivering subtle citrus hop flavors to complement a crisp, refreshing, tart finish.

The Siberians believed there was a âWorld Treeâ that served as the Axis Mundi, connecting the different worlds through its roots and branches.  While this Russian Imperial Stout isnât necessarily the worldâs cosmic axis, it does connect rich flavors in a way to deliver you a cosmic beer

Raspberries and chocolate go together like two peas in a pod. But don't worry, there's no peas in the Rubus Cacao. Rather the sweet chocolate, roasty bitterness and dark raspberry fruit combine in perfect harmony. Who knows, the Rubus might even become the pea in your pod!
We are thankful for hops, malted barley, cranberries, walnuts, vanilla beans and that only Pilgrim hops were sacrificed in the making of this beer.
Axis Mundi aged in bourbon barrels. Delicious.
